meanings.definition: The state or quality of being heavy or dull.
meanings.sent1: The leadennesses of the rock made it hard to lift.
meanings.sent2: The leadennesses of the sky indicated an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The leadennesses of the situation made everyone feel sleepy.
meanings.sent4: The leadennesses of the atmosphere weighed down on our spirits.
meanings.sent5: The leadennesses of the silence in the room was suffocating.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being weighed down or sluggish.
meanings.sent1: She struggled with the leadennesses in her limbs after the long hike.
meanings.sent2: The leadennesses of exhaustion crept over him after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: Despite the leadennesses, she managed to finish the race.
meanings.sent4: The leadennesses of boredom settled in during the lecture.
meanings.sent5: The leadennesses of disappointment hung heavy in the air.
